data.title: Mustai Karim, Huge New River Ship, Nears Completion for Vodohod - Cruise Industry News
data.meta_description: The new Mustai Karim, codenamed PV300, is nearing completion for Russian operator Vodohod at Krasnoye Sormovo ahead of her scheduled 2020 debut. The 333-guest ship will introduce a new product to Russian waters at 141 meters in length and nearly 17 meters in beam.  Having moved out of the building hall earlier…
data.text:
The new Mustai Karim, codenamed PV300, is nearing completion for Russian operator Vodohod at Krasnoye Sormovo ahead of her scheduled 2020 debut.

The 333-guest ship will introduce a new product to Russian waters at 141 meters in length and nearly 17 meters in beam.

Having moved out of the building hall earlier this week, the vessel is now almost ready for her launch and then sea trials. With the hull work done, the yard is putting the finishing touches on fire insulation, wastewater and other systems, according to a press release.

The ship will spend the 2020 season sailing Moscow/St. Petersburg itineraries.

Interested in the River Cruise Market? CIN’s 2020 European River Cruise Market Report is out in September. Learn more.

⠀
